channel.title: Assistance Required with an Error
channel.description:
When I compile I get an error saying: [code] Invalid method declaration; return type required[/code]
What does it mean please? What did I have to change?

item.title: Assistance Required with an Error
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

That is rather strange. Because before searching or asking about it, I opened up the ORIGINAL Client.Java and my current, compared the same lines with the original and they are exactly the same, spaces and all.

You asked for the compiler message I believe:

Read full topic

item.title: Assistance Required with an Error
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:5, topic:186572”][quote author=lawl link=topic=249037.msg2090077#msg2090077 date=1204771352]
you probably did something like ‘public method’ rather than ‘public [type] method’
[/quote]Is this one of those really really extremely rare and unbelievably special moments where you actually help people here? :P[/quote]
haha, no offense to you, lawl.

you forgot to specifiy a return type for the method.
make sure the method signature is valid, i.e.

access-specifier type name(args-list) { .... }

Read full topic

item.title: Assistance Required with an Error
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:186590”]you probably did something like ‘public method’ rather than ‘public [type] method’[/quote]Is this one of those special moments where you actually help people here?

Read full topic

item.title: Assistance Required with an Error
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

That’s what I wanted to know…what variable he was using…>_>

Read full topic

item.title: Assistance Required with an Error
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“LeScape, post:2, topic:186572”]Show us the whole compiler? To do so right click and hit select all, then hit enter. Then paste it into code tags.[/quote]You dont need to.

[quote=“zubmage, post:1, topic:186572”]When I compile I get an error saying: Invalid method declaration; return type required

What does it mean please? What did I have to change?[/quote]
What kind of return-type did you specify for the method? For you, this is probably after the ‘public’ word on that line. String? Void? Int? Byte? Once you know that, make sure you return a value equal to that data-type.

Read full topic

item.description:
